name: Chopin Hotel Prague City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location across the park from the railway station so its easy to get in and out of Prague. A comfortable walk to all the sites....in fact if you're light-footed you could cover all of them in a day! The breakfast was more than ample and the staff are great. Very professional and helpful and working on those smiles too! In room wifi excellent. One of the best value hotels we stayed at on a 6 week trip.
reviews.title: Convenient Location and Comfort Plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in October. Large rooms, clean and comfortable. Minimalist design (open shelves and hanging space.) Very good breakfast buffet. Good location near the main station - easy walking distance to the tourist centre but far enough away from the madding-crowd. Overall good value and we’ll stay here again. We booked ahead and got a good rate which made the hotel good value - their normal rates seemed a bit steep.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay in Prague especially if you're arriving by train. It's just across a small street from the main station. It is also very easy to walk from the hotel to the main sites. The room was clean, quiet and quite large. The staff is very friendly & helpful. One hint for breakfast, don't get there too late. Once they are out of something it is not replenished. One morning we were there and people who came later than us were complaining about there not being bread. Offerings at breakfast included granolas, yogurts, cheese, cold cuts & more. If we were to go to Prague again we would definitely stay here.
reviews.title: Great location & value

reviews.text: Great customer service, very helpful. Nice, clean hotel with decent sized room & bathroom. Free wifi in room. Basic hot/cold breakfast included in rate. 10-15 min walk to old town square, which is where all the action is. Opposite main train station (although double glazed windows cancel out any street noise). Highly recommended. Great value for $$
reviews.title: Excellent value, great location, breakfast included

reviews.text: I chose this hotel for its location near the main train station - it was handy for my arrival by train from Berlin, the Airport Express bus to PRG when I departed, and also for a day trip to Kutna Hora by train. Its location was OK for getting to the main tourist sites as well - a little under 15 minutes by foot to the Old Town Square.
reviews.title: The breakfast area is a problem

reviews.text: We arrived at the train station, walked down the ramp, and the hotel Chopin was basically right in front of us. Perfecto!
reviews.title: Excellent location, and great hotel.

reviews.text: Service at reception was good - staff were helpful. There was additional security on the door at night - not that we felt scared outside though!

reviews.text: Lovely clean hotel, great Location, the train station, metro,and trams, minutes away..Good enough breakfasts.We did not have a view, but we were not in the room long enough to bother.Would strongly recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the 10th to the 14th of july we stayed at Hotel Chopin in Prague (a former holiday-inn express hotel). The lady at the reception was very friendly and the check-in went very fast. Her english was good. Our room, located on the fifth floor, was very clean and modern, but rather dark because there was only a little window. We had one bed for 2 persons and this bed was rather small (too small in my opinion). There was a pretty modern flat screen tv and there was also airco which was good because it was very warm in Prague when we stayed there. At night you could hear the elevator, because our room was located next to it. Other than that it was very quiet. The bathroom was very clean. There was no bath, only a shower. The breakfast buffet was ok: there was enough choice: a lot of different sorts of bread (most of them tasted very salty), little croissants, eggs (not every day though), apples, cornflakes, yoghurt, two sorts of orange juice (not fresh though) etc. But to be honest we must say that we have had better breakfast buffets in other 3* hotels of the same price class. The hotel is located close to the raiway station and not that far from the heart of the city centre (I estimate it was a 15 minute-walk to the astronomical clock) and the most important shopping areas (it was not that far from the wenceslaus square where there are a lot of shops). At the end of our stay we asked if we could store our luggage for a couple of hours in the hotel, that wasn't a problem at all, which was nice.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed at Hotel Chopin for three nights .. Spotless, comfortable, quiet room at good price. Zuzana at the front desk was incredibly helpful. Ideal location if you're traveling by train. Out the front door of station and directly across the street ....then easy, pretty stroll to Old Town Square, etc ...also easy tram connection up to Prague Castle. (hint from Zuzana: don't get off at Prague Castle stop. Go 2 - 3 stops further and you will see much much more.) I don't understand complaints about breakfast...we found it to be more than ample with wide variety. (Hint from us: black light show Africanis at Imagine Black Light Theatre just off Old Town Square was sort of like Cirque du Soleil wannabes crossed with bad high school pep assembly skit.)
reviews.title: Will absolutely return to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel primarily based on proximity to the main train station (very close!) and cost. The quality of this hotel was not as good as I was expecting. I was not impressed with the front desk staff (in particular with regard to problems with a pre-arranged taxi to the airport), and the room was not very clean. It was a small room that didn't smell good -- (I requested a non-smoking room, but did not get one) -- and had stained carpet. At check-in they asked if we wanted one large bed or 2 small beds, and I chose the one large bed, which turned out to be a full-size (rather than a queen or king), with an uncomfortably soft mattress. The fan was up on the wall blowing directly on to the bed, which I also found to be uncomfortable. I was happy with the location. It was easy to walk to the city center and important attractions. Breakfast was fine, but a little too crowded.
reviews.title: Average hotel, good location

reviews.text: Hotel was very nice and tidy. Location is great. Rooms were lovely, though I missed a fridge in the room. I would definitely recommend Hotel Chopin for my friends. Thank You!
reviews.title: Compact package

description: The 3*** Superior Chopin Hotel Prague City, managed by Vienna International Hotels and Resorts, is located in the centre of Prague. Wenceslas Square, State Opera and many other sights and attractions are just a few minutes away. Each of the 80 comfortable rooms is well appointed in bright colours and feature air conditioning, high-speed Wi-Fi internet access and coffee/tea-making facilities free of charge. The conference room comes equipped with Internet access and has enough space for up to 25 people.
